title: Card-Based Microlearning for Strengthening Literature Quality Evaluation Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic academic research skills, understanding of research paper structure
context.additional_context: Modular learning using mobile apps in a BYOD environment. Emphasizes peer assessment and discussion activities.

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate the credibility of a given abstract based on five quality criteria: plagiarism status, methodological clarity, data sources, conclusion validity, and academic contribution
Learners can present three or more justifications to refute or supplement peer evaluations during card-based discussion activities
Learners can calculate real-time literature quality scores and propose improvement strategies using 20+ case studies provided by a mobile app

resources: Literature Quality Assessment Criteria Card Set

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
